Geolocation_API.summary: The Geolocation API allows the user to provide their location to web applications if they so desire. For privacy reasons, the user is asked for permission to report location information.

remarks.para: WebExtensions that wish to use the Geolocation object must add the "geolocation" permission to their manifest. The user's operating system will prompt the user to allow location access the first time it is requested.

blockquote.para: The geolocation element provides an alternative mechanism for accessing and handling geolocation data that solves some of the shortcomings of the Geolocation API: It provides a consistent UI, and a more intuitive permission management process.

Geolocation_APIUsing_the_Geolocation_API.summary: The Geolocation API is used to retrieve the user's location, so that it can for example be used to display their position using a mapping API. This article explains the basics of how to use it.
